name: Hood River Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a nice 2 night stay in a courtyard room. No matter how many times my husband heard we were staying in an historic hotel, he still expected to park at the door and walk into his room! So, street parking was a surprise, plus you do have to pay the meter, the hotel had a discounted full or 1/2 day parking pass. The room was cozy, with period type furniture, and very clean. The building slopes a bit, so you sure have a feeling of being in an older place, but they did such a nice job of mixing the old and the new, it was a nice difference from an ordinary hotel stay. Staff members were very pleasant and helpful, including the restaurant area. On Tues. nights there is a band playing a jazzy, island sound in the lobby. Most guests ended up here at one time or another that evening enjoying the music. This was a pleasant step back in history (old hotel pictures are everywhere) with even an old fashioned gated elevator!
reviews.title: Historic step in time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this quaint hotel which is located at the end of the strip in old "downtown" Hood River. It's not luxurious, but it's nice.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.text: Our room was on the third (top) floor, had two double beds, air conditioned, and on the street side. Nice, clean rooms, and no noise from adjoining rooms. The room wasn't huge, but you don't expect size in these older buildings. (There may be larger rooms because we noticed one room with a full kitchen and dining room.) The ceilings were a good height making the room feel bigger. The beds and pillows were average. Windows were a bit thin because street noise was noticeable. Not a big issue because the town is very quiet.
reviews.title: disappointed in service
Close to downtown (and the rail road tracks)
reviews.text: Good service from the hotel. Requested an iron and housekeeping brought the iron and ironing board promptly (and refused our tip).
You're within walking distance to everything in town, which offers some excellent cuisine options.
reviews.title: Pleasurable Stay-Excellent
Pictures of the courtyard rooms
reviews.text: I have previously written a review for this wonderful hotel, back when there wasn't an option to include photos. So my main reason for posting again is to share pictures. However I also wanted to comment because of a previous reviewer who stated that this hotel may not be for younger people. I think it's unfair to assume that younger travellers won't enjoy this hotel. My husband and I are both in our 20's and we loved it! We never once felt out of place based on our age. In fact, the front desk staff seemed to be in their 20's themselves. It was over a year ago, so I unfortunately can't remember the ages of the other staff we saw, (mostly 30's and 40's maybe??). We did not see any age-discrimination behavior from the staff at all. We've stayed at expensive, modern establishments where they looked down their noses at us simply because we were "that young couple" and treated us like unwanted alien lifeforms because of our age, but this hotel is NOT one of those snooty places at all! So if you enjoy old historic hotels, please don't let your age be a factor in deciding whether you'll enjoy staying here.
We only spent one night at the Hood River Hotel but that one night was more than enough for us to wish we’d scheduled at least another night or two.
reviews.title: loved it....
Good Value, Great staff
reviews.text: I had read the reports from some who thought it was “squeaky”, old or run down, and I found none of this to be true. Any hotel this age that is rich in woods might have a squeak or tow but nothing that would bother the average traveler. From the dark woods in the lobby to an extraordinary room that is seemingly furnished from the Vanderbilt’s era everything was perfect for my wife and I.

reviews.title: Don't leave anything behind
reviews.text: Now, if you are a youngster that thinks chrome and vinyl dictates style than this probably won’t be on your list. We’ve stayed at the El Tovar Hotel in the Grand Canyon and Wawona Hotel in Yosemite and consider the Hood River Hotel as a near equal.

reviews.title: I really enjoyed my stay!
reviews.text: If you want a pristine cookie cutter Holiday Inn or Marriott, this is not your place. I have stayed here several times. It is very clean and the staff is very helpful. Excellent beds. Although I am very "noise sensitive," the trains running about 75 yards from the Riverview rooms did not bother me once I fell asleep ... and that came quickly.

reviews.title: Great romantic getaway
reviews.text: My hubby and I stayed here several years ago for our anniversary. Romantic charm, large room! Living room, full kitchen, 2 baths, and 2 beds in the bedroom. Got a great deal on a suite with our entertainment card, less than 100 dollars per night for that. it was bigger than our apartment!

reviews.title: great location but uncomfortable
reviews.text: The elevator was slow, so we took the stairs, and the floors could be creaky, but that did not seem to bother us. Being able to watch a movie in the room, and make our own popcorn, and then make breakfast in the morning was great, and the town is beautiful (budget conscience you know!)

reviews.title: decent with some problems
reviews.text: We plan on returning there again this year.

reviews.title: Not for light sleepers
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hood River Hotel a few weeks ago and was disappointed in the room. I had an inside room which overlooked their garden and it was very hot. I had to sleep with the window open which made me uncomfortable as a woman traveling alone. The front desk attendant assured me the room would cool down but it never did. I chose the hotel for it's central location and ambience, both of which are great. But if you have a car there is only metered parking. Next time I will choose a different location and forgo the historic atmosphere.

reviews.title: A Place With Style
reviews.text: We stayed here last year for our Honeymoon. Since we'd splurged while in other places we thought we would go on the less expensive end. For an historic hotel 69 bucks was nice but few conveniences were included.

reviews.title: This is a problem hotel
reviews.text: Although this hotel is centrally located, clean and reasonably priced, its hotel staff did not seem welcoming to me nor did they seem particularly interested in making sure I was taken care of. When I asked to read the morning paper while having my morning coffee -- the paper was sitting on the reception desk -- the female receptionist sneered at me and said sharply, "Just bring it back!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are TINY; the showers are old and ony sprinkle out small dropletts of water. If you get put in a "river view" room, be prepared to see everything EXCEPT the river.
reviews.title: Quaint, reasonable price, great location

likes.disliked: — unable to control air conditioner in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So what is the view? It's a fine view of the rooftop of a pizza restaurant, parking lot, a set of railroad tracks, the friggin freeway and a few access roads. Beyond all that is the river, and then you can only see part of it. The term "river view" is highly misleading.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then there is the train problem. Between you and the distant river are rail tracks that move mile-long trains alongside your window at all hours of the day and night, blowing their horns and making all kinds of racket. One right after the other. On and on. The noise is less pronounced with the windows closed, though even then I was awakened repeatedly throughout the night. If you want fresh air with the window open, forget it. You can hardly talk to another person in the same room! Or if you want to talk on the phone, hopefully you won't need to make an important call because regardless of whether the window is open or closed, the sound of the trains will definitely be heard on the other end of the line.
reviews.title: Lots of character, good value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And then you have the 18-wheeler trucks. In the parking lot outside my window was a large parking lot. In it, a semi-truck idled all night long while its driver slept inside the cab. So during the very short period between the loud-as-hell trains, you had the sound of idling trucks.

description: National Historic Landmark boutique hotel in downtown Hood River, with antique furnishings and full modern conveniences. We feature on-site dining, free Wi-Fi, meeting space for groups, spa and fitness center. Walking distance to wine tasting, brew pubs, shopping and recreation.
